TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TimeSpanValidatorAttribute extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttribute
Public NotInheritable Class TimeSpanValidatorAttribute Inherits ConfigurationValidatorAttribute

Docs.summary: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform time validation on a configuration property. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute> attribute to decorate a configuration property. This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute> objects to property types only.
## Examples The following example shows how to decorate the properties of a custom <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> object using the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute> attribute.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/CS/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/VB/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.vb#8)]
The following example is an excerpt of the configuration file that contains the custom section used by the previous sample.
```xml <configuration xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/.NetConfiguration/v2.0"> <configSections> <section name="custom" type="Microsoft.Samples.AspNet.Configuration.SampleSection, ConfigurationValidatorAttribute" /> </configSections> <custom fileName="NewFile.txt" maxSize="1000" maxAttempts="101" maxUsers="2500" maxIdleTime="00:15:00" /> </configuration> ```

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the type of the value assigned to the related property is a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range as defined by and .
Docs.value: if the value must be excluded; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValueString%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValueString%2A> properties. When the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the absolute maximum value allowed by the .NET Framework. Its value is defined by the <xref:System.TimeSpan.MaxValue> field.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ValidatorInstance As ConfigurationValidatorBase

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.ValidatorInstance%2A> property to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
